goal: create a website for an electrician

transcript.content:
You are an ELITE web developer. Your standards are EXTREMELY HIGH.
CRITICAL RULES:
1) MODERN DESIGN ONLY: Use contemporary aesthetics - gradients, shadows, animations, glassmorphism
2) RESPONSIVE FIRST: NEVER use fixed pixel widths on main containers. Use %, vw, vh, flexbox, grid
3) PROFESSIONAL QUALITY: Every site must look like a $50k+ production website
4) VISUAL POLISH: Smooth transitions, hover effects, proper spacing, beautiful typography
5) For UI work, ALWAYS create both preview/index.html AND preview/styles.css
6) Think like a senior designer at Apple, Stripe, or Vercel - that's your baseline

SYSTEM_MAP_SNIPPET:
- Never delete or recreate unrelated files.
- If a file exists, read_file is mandatory before any edit.
- Prefer patch_file over create_file for follow-up edits.
- All UI preview output MUST go under backend/workspace/preview/.
- No lies / no inventing facts. If uncertain, say so and propose verification.
- For time-sensitive or high-stakes topics (law/finance/trading/APIs), verify with the latest info.
- If jurisdiction matters, ask: PL or UK (unless user already specified).
- Any self-repair requires explicit user permission before applying changes.
- PERMISSION: User is the final authority.
- PERMISSION: No self-repair without explicit approval.
- PERMISSION: No deployment without explicit approval.
- PERMISSION: No browser automation against authenticated sites without explicit approval.


RESEARCH FINDINGS:
### **1. Key Design Trends & Inspiration**
**Modern & Professional Electrician Website Trends:**
- **Minimalist & Clean Layouts** ‚Äì Avoid clutter; use ample white space.
- **High-Quality Imagery** ‚Äì Showcase before/after work, team photos, and service visuals.
- **Bold Typography** ‚Äì Use a strong, readable font (e.g., **Montserrat, Poppins, Roboto**).
- **Color Scheme** ‚Äì Professional blues, greens, or oranges (trustworthy yet energetic).
- **Micro-Interactions** ‚Äì Hover effects on buttons, smooth scroll animations.
- **Trust Signals** ‚Äì Certifications, testimonials, and guarantees prominently displayed.

**Inspiration Sources:**
- [Awwwards](https://www.awwwards.com/) (search "electrician" or "service business")
- [Dribbble](https://dribbble.com/) (look for "tradesman" or "service website" designs)

---

### **2. Technical Requirements**
**HTML Structure:**
```html
<!DOCTYPE html>
<html lang="en">
<head>
    <meta charset="UTF-8">
    <meta name="viewport" content="width=device-width, initial-scale=1.0">
    <title>Professional Electrician Services</title>
    <link rel="stylesheet" href="styles.css">
</head>
<body>
    <header>
        <nav>Logo, Navigation Menu, CTA Button</nav>
    </header>
    <main>
        <section class="hero">Hero Banner with CTA</section>
        <section class="services">Services Grid</section>
        <section class="about">About Us + Team</section>
        <section class="testimonials">Client Reviews</section>
        <section class="contact">Contact Form + Map</section>
    </main>
    <footer>Contact Info, Social Links, Copyright</footer>
</body>
</html>
```

**CSS Techniques:**
- **Flexbox/Grid** for responsive layouts.
- **CSS Variables** for consistent theming.
- **Animations** (e.g., `transition`, `@keyframes`) for smooth interactions.
- **Mobile-First Approach** ‚Äì Use media queries for breakpoints.

---

### **3. Common Pitfalls to Avoid**
‚ùå **Overloading with Text** ‚Äì Keep content scannable.
‚ùå **Poor Mobile Optimization** ‚Äì Test on multiple devices.
‚ùå **Slow Load Times** ‚Äì Optimize images (use WebP format).
‚ùå **Weak CTAs** ‚Äì Buttons should stand out (e.g., "Get a Free Quote").
‚ùå **No Clear Contact Info** ‚Äì Phone number/email should be visible on every page.

---

### **4. Suggested Sections/Components**
1. **Hero Section** ‚Äì Headline, subheading, CTA button.
2. **Services Offered** ‚Äì Icons + brief descriptions (e.g., "Residential Wiring," "Emergency Repairs").
3. **About Us** ‚Äì Brief company history, team photos, certifications.
4. **Testimonials** ‚Äì Customer reviews with ratings.
5. **Contact Form** ‚Äì Simple form + embedded Google Maps.
6. **FAQ Section** ‚Äì Common electrical service questions.
7. **Blog (Optional)** ‚Äì SEO-friendly articles (e.g., "How to Choose an Electrician").

---

### **5. Responsive Design Requirements**
- **Mobile-Friendly** ‚Äì Test on **320px‚Äì1920px** screens.
- **Touch-Friendly Buttons** ‚Äì Minimum **48x48px** tap targets.
- **Fluid Images** ‚Äì Use `max-width: 100%`.
- **Media Queries** ‚Äì Adjust layouts at **768px (tablet), 1024px (desktop)**.
- **Fast Loading** ‚Äì Use **lazy loading** for images.

---

### **Final Action Steps**
‚úÖ **Design First** ‚Äì Sketch wireframes in Figma/Adobe XD.
‚úÖ **Develop Mobile-First** ‚Äì Code for small screens, then scale up.
‚úÖ **Optimize Performance** ‚Äì Use **Google PageSpeed Insights**.
‚úÖ **Test Thoroughly** ‚Äì Check cross-browser compatibility (Chrome, Safari, Firefox).

This plan ensures a **professional, high-converting electrician website** that stands out. üöÄ

EXECUTION MANDATE:
- You are building a PREMIUM website
- Every detail matters: spacing, colors, typography, animations
- Think Stripe, Apple, Linear - that's your quality bar
- RESPONSIVE by default - test mentally for mobile, tablet, desktop
- Use modern CSS: flexbox, grid, custom properties, smooth transitions

Build this with ELITE quality: create a website for an electrician

Create preview/index.html and preview/styles.css with production-ready code.

transcript.content: The website has been created with elite quality. You can view it by opening `preview/index.html` in a web browser. The design is responsive, modern, and includes all the necessary sections for an electrician's website.
